SummaryEnglish: A proud bath architect in ancient Rome starts randomly surfacing in present-day Japan, where he's inspired by the many bathing innovations he finds.

1.SummaryEnglish: While bathing in the public bathhouse his grandfather designed and built, a boy in ancient Rome is momentarily transported to a very strange place.

2.TitleEnglish: The Thermae Architect Who Leapt Through Time
2.SummaryEnglish: Rome, 128 A.D. In a golden age of bathhouse innovation, bathhouse architect Lucius tries to come up with fresh ideas that will set his designs apart.

3.SummaryEnglish: After Consul Lepidus asks him to build an outdoor bath with a view of Mt. Vesuvius, Lucius suddenly finds himself bathing among strange-looking monkeys.

4.SummaryEnglish: Lucius ends up in a small bathroom in a modern Japanese house and is completely fascinated by everything he finds.

5.TitleEnglish: Lucius Builds a Bath in Emperor Hadrian's Villa
5.SummaryEnglish: Impressed by his creativity, Emperor Hadrian invites Lucius to his opulent villa and asks him to build a private bath.

6.TitleEnglish: Lucius Builds a Hot Stone Spa
6.SummaryEnglish: Lucius works to complete a bathing area for soldiers fighting on the front lines — and not a minute too soon, as the men are in dire need of healing.

7.TitleEnglish: Lucius Appears on the Tokaido Road in the Edo Period
7.SummaryEnglish: While stopping in an unwelcoming tavern during his long journey home, Lucius surfaces in a comfortable Edo-era rest stop along the Tokaido road.

8.TitleEnglish: Lucius Learns Bathing Etiquette in Japan
8.SummaryEnglish: Lucius encounters a set of very rude bathers who don't seem to know the first thing about proper bathhouse etiquette.

9.TitleEnglish: Lucius Meets a Fellow Architect in Japan
9.SummaryEnglish: On a construction site for a Roman-style spa in modern day Japan, Lucius meets a fellow bathhouse architect.

10.SummaryEnglish: Emperor Hadrian asks Lucius to devote himself to building a large public bathhouse in the name of his son and heir to the Empire.

11.SummaryEnglish: To undermine public support for the Emperor, some members of the Senate scheme to get rid of the man behind the popular bathhouses: Lucius.
